titleStmt.title: Justice perverted, and innocence & loyalty oppressed, or, A detection of the corruptions of some persons in places of great trust in the government which would have been laid open the last session of Parliament, according to the intentions of both Houses, had it not been prevented.
titleStmt.author: Crosfeild, Robert.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Robert Crosfeild by Wing (2nd ed.), and concerns corrupt practices within the navy.
Imperfect: stained and tightly bound, with loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
